name: NPR
text:
In 1965, James Baldwin and William F. Buckley debated whether the American dream "is at the expense of the American Negro." Now, the Atlantic's David Frum and Harvard's Khalil Muhammad are reimagining that debate for the March on Washington Film Festival.
https://t.co/3CJUCHDB4L

name: NPR
text:
As U.S. employers shed millions of permanent, full-time jobs, people are increasingly having to turn to freelancing as a means of survival.

And some experts say that shift is likely to continue.
https://t.co/jfejihv5vY

name: NPR
text:
Under the new deal, Oracle will host all of TikTok's U.S. user data and will safeguard TikTok's computer systems "to ensure U.S. national security requirements are fully satisfied," TikTok said in a statement.
https://t.co/flVJ8McRsK

name: NPR
text: Democratic Sen. Cory Booker, who sits on the judiciary committee, told NPR on Sunday that he believes lawmakers should let the winner of November's presidential election select a nominee. https://t.co/W0cxUqJA9g

name: NPR
text:
Over the last 40 years, nearly 90% of the live corals that once covered the Florida Reef Tract have died off. Now, researchers in South Florida have figured out a way to get coral to spawn more rapidly.
https://t.co/zvkx3YZ70k

name: NPR
text:
Frank Gehry's advice to up-and-coming architects: Don’t aim to be the next Frank Gehry — and stay true to yourself. “Let your designs come naturally out of you and you'll prevail and become who you are,” he says.
https://t.co/Mv0E2vMbrz

name: NPR
text:
When Argentina went into a strict lockdown in March, photographer Celeste Alonso began documenting her life in isolation with black-and-white Polaroids.

Her use of instant images allows Alonso to exert some control in a world that seems out of control.
https://t.co/HezInhgON9

name: NPR
text:
Season 2 of Hulu's "PEN15" expands upon the exciting and traumatic themes of puberty.

Critic Aisha Harris says the comedy's co-creators have found new ways to burrow the growing pangs and embarrassments of adolescence even deeper, to cathartic effect.
https://t.co/SXZC21ExOR

name: NPR
text:
The mortality rates from COVID-19 in ICUs have been decreasing worldwide, doctors say, at least partly because of recent advances in treatment.
https://t.co/UYBIZXD5eh
